title: The Bachelorette's Jackson Garlick works out in Sydney
text:
He was rewarded with a rose on Wednesday's episode of The Bachelorette, despite Angie Kent suffering from motion sickness on a helicopter date.

But it was business as usual on Tuesday for the 25-year-old pie maker, as he lifted weights during a gym session in Sydney.

The muscle-bound reality showed off his physique as he performed various exercises under the instruction of a personal trainer.

Scroll down for video

Pumping iron! The Bachelorette's Jackson Garlick was spotted lifting weights during a gym session in Sydney on Tuesday

Despite being the youngest suitor on The Bachelorette, Jackson is already one of the favourites to win Angie's heart.

On Wednesday, she chose him for a single date and the pair took to the skies in a helicopter.

But things didn't go to plan when Angie, 29, began suffering from motion sickness.

What a hunk! The muscle-bound reality showed off his physique as he performed various exercises under the instruction of a personal trainer

'It was beautiful looking around and seeing the ocean so high up. But this gal forgets that she gets motion sickness!' she told producers afterwards.

During the date, all colour drained from Angie's face and Jackson asked her if she was feeling okay.

Getting worried, he then started searching frantically for a sick bag, only to realise there wasn't one.

Flying high: On Wednesday's episode of The Bachelorette, Angie chose Jackson for a single date and the pair took to the skies in a helicopter

'You can spew in my top pocket if you want,' he said, with Angie telling him, 'That would be the worst thing ever!'

Despite Angie saying the date was a 'disaster', Jackson assured her it was okay and he was eventually rewarded with a rose.

The Bachelorette continues Thursday at 7:30pm on Channel 10

Pass the sick bag! But things didn't go to plan when Angie began experiencing motion sickness
description: He was rewarded with a rose on Wednesday's episode of The Bachelorette, despite Angie Kent suffering from motion sickness on a helicopter date.
authors: Jo Scrimshire For Daily Mail Australia
